hero.title: Discover Rome
hero.subtitle: Your guide to the Eternal City

colosseum.title: Colosseum
colosseum.subtitle: Ancient Amphitheater
colosseum.description: The iconic symbol of Rome and the largest amphitheater ever built. Book tickets in advance to avoid long queues.

vatican.title: Vatican Museums
vatican.subtitle: Art & History
vatican.description: Home to some of the world's most important art collections, including the Sistine Chapel.

trevi.title: Trevi Fountain
trevi.subtitle: Baroque Fountain
trevi.description: The largest Baroque fountain in Rome. Don't forget to throw a coin to ensure your return to the city!

tips.title: Dining Tips
tips.subtitle: How to Eat Like a Local

centro.title: Centro Storico
centro.subtitle: Historic Center
centro.description: Perfect for first-time visitors. Walking distance to major attractions. Higher prices but worth the convenience.

trastevere.title: Trastevere
trastevere.subtitle: Charming & Bohemian
trastevere.description: Picturesque neighborhood with great restaurants and nightlife. Popular among young travelers.

monti.title: Monti
monti.subtitle: Hip & Local
monti.description: Trendy area with boutiques and cafes. Close to the Colosseum but less touristy.

spring.title: Spring (Mar-May)
spring.description: Mild temperatures, occasional rain. Perfect for sightseeing.

summer.title: Summer (Jun-Aug)
summer.description: Hot and crowded. Early morning or evening visits recommended.

fall.title: Fall (Sep-Nov)
fall.description: Pleasant weather, fewer crowds. Ideal for outdoor activities.

winter.title: Winter (Dec-Feb)
winter.description: Cool and less crowded. Good for museum visits and winter sales.
